body: @aahmed-se moving forward I would suggest separate code changes to change framework from actual tests (e.g. moving the smoke module from arquillian to testcontainers). because migrating smoke modules don't really depend on the framework changes in this PR. in this way, we can move the ball on migrating modules from arqullian to testcontainers much faster.
thank you @mgodave . will take a look at this.
Yes, noticed that. I'll take a look
Closed this issue since the question is answered.

@rdhabalia From 2.0, the `consumer.ack()` is not really throwing exception anymore. The signature was not changed to avoid compile errors when upgrading, but even when disconnected from broker, the ack will never throw exception.

> but even when disconnected from broker, the ack will never throw exception.

umm.. but [Consumer](https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/blob/master/pulsar-client/src/main/java/org/apache/pulsar/client/impl/ConsumerImpl.java#L414) returns failed-future if consumer is not connected with broker and it will miss the acking of that message. so, it seems this logic is still present with 2.0?
Seems integration test still have some issue, change back to Work In Progress

> umm.. but Consumer returns failed-future if consumer is not connected with broker and it will miss the acking of that message. so, it seems this logic is still present with 2.0?

It should only fail if the consumer is being closed, not when it's disconnected from broker
I see.. somehow, our sink is acking all the messages but still we see ack-holes for the subscription. let me debug more to figure out the issue.

@merlimat 
I didn't get chance to debug it fully but I think issue for `org.apache.pulsar.client.impl.SequenceIdWithErrorTest.testCheckSequenceId` at [producer creation](https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/blob/master/pulsar-broker/src/main/java/org/apache/pulsar/broker/service/ServerCnx.java#L821). This test fences the managed-ledger and SchemaService's managed-ledger is not able to recover properly which is somehow not completing schema-future and producer creation gets stuck which causes send-timeout.
```
java.util.concurrent.CompletionException: org.apache.pulsar.broker.service.BrokerServiceException$PersistenceException: java.util.concurrent.CompletionException: org.apache.pulsar.broker.service.BrokerServiceException$PersistenceException: org.apache.bookkeeper.mledger.ManagedLedgerException$ManagedLedgerFencedException: java.lang.Exception: Attempted to use a fenced managed ledger
:
at org.apache.pulsar.broker.service.schema.BookkeeperSchemaStorage$Functions.lambda$0(BookkeeperSchemaStorage.java:439) ~[classes/:?]
```
is it possible to add unit test-cases for the changes?
sorry for late response. @dsambandam do you mind providing me the list of commands you are invoking? so I can try to reproduce it.
@rdhabalia will need to take a deeper look at the handleProducer code , this change is mostly to disable empty test methods to remove them from reporting.
@jerrypeng @srkukarni @rdhabalia please spend some time on reviewing this.
this has been replaced by individual test migration pr's
@aahmed-se can you update the caption and description?

@merlimat @jiazhai I have updated this feature as you suggested.
I haven't yet added tests for this or fixed any old ones, just made sure it compiles. I will test this ASAP, just wanted to make sure this functionality is OK before I go any further.

This is what was done in the latest commits:

- Additional property "Mode" was added to "CommandGetTopicsOfNamespace" entity of Pulsar binary API via Protobuf. This is a enum that has 3 values: "Persistent", "Non-Persistent", or "All". Value "Persistent" was set to be the default one.

- Broker binary protocol server code was updated to retrieve topics from lookup based on this enum. More importantly, broker will attempt to retrieve a list of non-persistent topics from another cluster if necessary. A pool of Pulsar Clients was made for that purpose inside NamespaceService.

- I have attempted to do the same for HTTP APIs, but I have only done so for API V1. I am not sure what to do about API V2, as it seems to use a somewhat more complicated functionality.

- Client code was updated to support this. When building a consumer it is now possible to specify to which kind of topics you want to subscribe when using pattern subscription.

Will be glad to receive your feedback.
can we add  `CommandAckDeprecated` in proto-schema which can be used by client if broker-verison is < `V12` ?
/cc @cckellogg since he knows how tricky to use this popover stuffs
what is the current status of this PR?

Almost done with the migration gotten rid of the arquillian dependencies
tests are not passing yet so have to debug a bit.

-Ali

On Mon, Jul 9, 2018 at 2:38 AM Ivan Kelly <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> *@ivankelly* requested changes on this pull request.
>
> Compaction and s3 should be changed in separate PRs. As it is I don't
> think s3 is being migrated.
> ------------------------------
>
> In
> tests/integration/s3-offload/src/test/java/org/apache/pulsar/tests/integration/TestS3Offload.java
> <https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/pull/2101#discussion_r200938995>
> :
>
> > @@ -59,9 +61,11 @@
>      @BeforeMethod
>      public void configureAndStartBrokers() throws Exception {
>
> -        String s3ip = DockerUtils.cubeIdsWithLabels(
> -                docker, ImmutableMap.of("service", "s3", "cluster", CLUSTER_NAME))
> -            .stream().map((c) -> DockerUtils.getContainerIP(docker, c)).findFirst().get();
> +//        String s3ip = DockerUtils.cubeIdsWithLabels(
>
> Remove commented out code.
> ------------------------------
>
> In
> tests/integration-tests-topologies/src/main/java/org/apache/pulsar/tests/topologies/PulsarCluster.java
> <https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/pull/2101#discussion_r200939801>
> :
>
> > @@ -112,6 +108,12 @@ private PulsarCluster(PulsarClusterSpec spec) {
>              .withEnv("zookeeperServers", ZKContainer.NAME)
>              .withEnv("configurationStoreServers", CSContainer.NAME + ":" + CS_PORT)
>              .withEnv("clusterName", clusterName);
> +
> +        this.s3Container = new S3Container(clusterName, S3Container.NAME)
>
> It'd be better to create a subclass of PulsarCluster, PulsarClusterWithS3,
> and only start S3 in that case. As it is now, S3 is being started for all
> cases.
> ------------------------------
>
> In
> tests/integration/s3-offload/src/test/java/org/apache/pulsar/tests/integration/TestS3Offload.java
> <https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/pull/2101#discussion_r200940135>

> +import org.testng.annotations.DataProvider;
>  import org.testng.annotations.Test;
>
>  public class TestS3Offload extends Arquillian {
>

It is caught by a cluster-mode integration test.
@merlimat @jiazhai can you review this PR and give @gordeevbr some feedback?

When it happens during bundles movement to another broker, it will be much better to wait until the correspondent bundles are moved until the next retry.

Clients could be probably notified by brokers about bundles status.
